member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX
member.summary: Displays rich ink and voice content.
member.remarks: This class was previously named OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.InkX

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of RichInk.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of the InkX control.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.Play
member.summary: Plays the currently selected voice object.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.Stop
member.summary: Stops the currently playing audio (if applicable).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.Record
member.summary: Starts recording a new voice clip.

member.summary: Message notification for InkX

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.CreateParams
member.summary: Parameters for Control2 and wndproc

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.EnableVoiceBar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines whether the VoiceBar is displayed.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true will display the VoiceBar.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.DataLength
member.summary: Gets the length in bytes of the ink data in the main compose window.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.Data
member.summary: Gets or Sets the raw data contained in the compose window.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.IsPlaying
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control is currently playing audio.
member.value: Returns TRUE if the control is playing voice audio, else returns FALSE.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.IsRecording
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control is currently recording audio.
member.value: Returns TRUE if the control is recording voice audio, else returns FALSE.

member.summary: Base message

member.summary: Required

member.summary: Used to retrieve the data.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.InkXMessage.SetData
member.summary: Used to set the data. Stores the Ink data from a previous IM_GETDATA call which will be inserted into the current compose window.

member.summary: Used to erase all contents from the current compose window.

member.summary: Sent to toggle the VoiceBar state

member.summary: Used to get the window handle to the RichInk control.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.InkXMessage.IsVoiceRecording
member.summary: Returns TRUE if we're currently recording

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.InkXMessage.VoiceStop
member.summary: Causes the voicebar to halt playback or recording (if either is in progress).

member.summary: Plays a currently selected voice object

member.summary: This will begin recording to an inline embedded object.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Forms.InkX.InkXMessage.IsVoicePlaying
member.summary: Returns TRUE if we're currently playing voice data.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Vibrate
member.summary: Controls vibration on the device.
member.remarks: Supported only on Smartphone. Previously named OpenNETCF.Notification.Vibrate. Vibration equipped Pocket PC devices emulate the Vibration motor as a notification Led.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Vibrate.Play
member.summary: Plays the default looping vibration on the device.
member.returns: TRUE if vibration started successfully else FALSE.

platform.os: Pocket PC Phone Edition, Windows Mobile 2003 for Smartphone

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Vibrate.Stop
member.summary: Stops any current vibration.

platform.os: Pocket PC Phone Edition, Windows Mobile 2003 for Smartphone

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Vibrate.GetDeviceCaps(OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Vibrate.VibrationCapabilities)
member.summary: Gets the current device vibration capabilities.
member.param: Member of the VibrationCapabilities enumeration identifying what capability to query.
member.returns: 0 if the capability is not supported, 1 if a single level is supported or a value between 2 and 7 if multiple levels are supported.
member.remarks: This function returns the number of vibration steps (a number from 0 to 7) that the device hardware supports for the requested vibration capability.

platform.os: Pocket PC Phone Edition, Windows Mobile 2003 for Smartphone

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Vibrate.VibrationCapabilities
member.summary: Used by the GetDeviceCaps function to query the device vibration capabilities.

platform.os: Pocket PC Phone Edition, Windows Mobile 2003 for Smartphone

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Vibrate.VibrationCapabilities.Amplitude
member.summary: Query the amplitude that the device supports.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsMobile.Vibrate.VibrationCapabilities.Frequency
member.summary: Query the frequency that the device supports.
